questiontext.text: If a die is rolled one time, find these probabilities:

subquestion.text: Getting a number less than 7
Getting a number greater than or equal to 3
Getting a number greater than 2 and an even number
Getting a number less than 1

questiontext.text: A probability experiment is conducted. Which of these cannot be considered a probability outcome? (Select all that apply)
If two dice are rolled one time, find the probability of getting a sum less than or equal to 9.
If two dice are rolled once, find the probability of getting a sum less than or equal to 9.
If a card is drawn from a deck, find the probability of drawing a black king.
If a card is drawn from a deck, find the probability of drawing a diamond or a heart.
A breakdown of the sources of energy used in the United States is shown below. Choose one energy source at random. Find the probability that it is not oil.
Select all pairs of events that are mutually exclusive.

answer.text: Roll two dice: Get a sum of 7 or get doubles
Select a student in your college: The student is a sophomore and the student is a business major.
Select any course: It is a calculus course and it is an English course.
Select a registered voter: The voter is a Republican and the voter is a Democrat.

questiontext.text: Select all pairs of events that are independent.

answer.text: Having a large shoe size and having a high IQ.
A father being left-handed and a daughter being left-handed.
Smoking excessively and having lung cancer.
Eating an excessive amount of ice cream and smoking an excessive amount of cigarettes.

questiontext.text: When an event is certain to occur, what is its probability?
If an event cannot happen, what value is assigned to its probability?
What is the sum of the probabilities of all the outcomes in a sample space?
If the probability that it will rain tomorrow is 0.20, what is the probability that it will not rain tomorrow?
If one of the 50 states is chosen at random, what is the possibility that it doesn't begin with a vowel? Express your answer as a decimal.

Of all the U.S. album sales in 2014, 1989 (Taylor Swift) accounted for 25% of sales, Frozen (various artists) accounted for 24.1% of sales, and In the Lonely Hour (Sam Smith) accounted for 8.2% of sales. What is the probability that a randomly selected album was something other than these three albums? Express your answer as a decimal.

Rural speed limits for all 50 states are indicated below.

Choose one state at random. Find the probability that its rural speed limit is 70 miles per hour or less. Express your answer as a decimal.

Elementary and secondary schools were classified by the number of computers they had. Choose one school at random. Find the probability that it has 50 or fewer computers. Express your answer as a decimal.

A media rental store rented the following number of movie titles from each of these categories: 170 horror, 230 drama, 120 mystery, 310 romance, and 150 comedy. If a person selects a movie to rent, find the probability that it is a romance or a comedy. Express your answer as a decimal.

At a used-book sale, 100 books are adult books and 160 are children's books. Of the adult books, 70 are nonfiction while 60 of the children's books are nonfiction. If a book is selected at random, find the probability that it is an adult book or a children's nonfiction book. Express your answer as a decimal.

The chart below shows the numbers of endangered and threatened species both here in the United States and abroad.

Choose one species at random. Find the probability that it is an endangered foreign bird. Express your answer as a decimal.

The probability that John will drive to school is 0.37, the probability that he will ride with friends is 0.23, and the probability that his parents will take him is 0.4. He is not allowed to have passengers in the car when he is driving. What is the probability that John will have company on the way to school? Express your answer as a decimal.
The data show the U.S. population by age. Choose one person at random and find the probability that the person is between 20 and 64 years old. Express your answer as a decimal.

In a recent year there were the following numbers (in thousands) of licensed drivers in the United States.

Choose one driver at random. Find the probability that the driver is male and 19 years or under. Express your answer as a decimal.

A local post carrier distributes first-class letters, advertisements, and magazines. For a certain day, she distributed the following numbers of each type of item.

If an item of mail is selected at random, find the probability that it was a first-class letter or it went to a home. Express your answer as a decimal.
Two dice are rolled. Find the probability of getting doubles or a sum of 7. Express your answer as a decimal.

The Gallup Poll reported that 52% of Americans used a seat belt the last time they got into a car. If 4 people are selected at random, find the probability that they all used a seat belt the last time they got into a car. Express your answer as a decimal.
If 25% of U.S. federal prison inmates are not U.S. citizens, find the probability that 2 randomly selected federal prison inmates will not be U.S. citizens. Express your answer as a decimal.

A bag contains 9 red marbles, 8 white marbles, and 6 blue marbles. Randomly choose two marbles, one at a time, and without replacement. Find the probability that both marbles are the same color. Express your answer as a decimal.
A flashlight has 6 batteries, 2 of which are defective. If 2 are selected at random without replacement, find the probability that both are defective. Express your answer as a decimal.
In a scientific study there are 8 guinea pigs, 5 of which are pregnant. If 3 are selected at random without replacement, find the probability that all are pregnant. Express your answer as a decimal.

At a gathering consisting of 10 men and 20 women, two door prizes are awarded. The winning ticket is not replaced. Find the probability that both prizes are won by men. Express your answer as a decimal.

It is reported that 72% of working women use computers at work. Choose 5 working women at random. Find the probability that at least one of them does not use a computer at work. Express your answer as a decimal.

At the Avonlea Country Club, 73% of the members play bridge and swim, and 82% play bridge. If a member is selected at random, find the probability that the member swims, given that the member plays bridge. Express your answer as a decimal.

Below is given the summary from the 112th Congress of Senators whose terms end in 2013, 2015, or 2017.

Choose one of the Senators at random, and find the \( P(\text{Republican} | \text{term expires in 2017}) \). Express your answer as a decimal.

The Gift Basket Store had the following premade gift baskets containing the following combinations in stock.

Choose one basket at random. Find the probability that it contains tea, given that it contains mugs. Express your answer as a decimal.

Below are listed the numbers of doctors in various specialties by gender.

The characteristics "female" and "pathologist" are independent.
